sexpression

Class NamedPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • sexpression.ASExpression
      • sexpression.NamedPattern

  • public class NamedPattern
extends ASExpression
    A named pattern represents any expression whose intended use is as a pattern for a match operation. They are especially useful in ASExpression.namedMatch. A call to namedMatch on a pattern that contains named patterns as subexpressions will result in a mapping for each named pattern to the subexpression which matches it. Note that named patterns can contain wildcard expressions.

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public ASExpression match(ASExpression target)
        Description copied from class: ASExpression
        Treat this ASExpression as a pattern and attempt to match another expression against it.
        Specified by:
        match in class ASExpression
        Parameters:
        target - The target expression to be matched.
        Returns:
        If target does not match the pattern, NoMatch.SINGLETON is returned. If target matches the pattern, a ListExpression is returned. If pattern has no wildcards, the returned list is empty. If pattern contains wildcards, the returned list contains, in order of inorder traversal, the subexpressions of target that were matched by those wildcards.
        See Also:
        ASExpression.match(sexpression.ASExpression)

      • namedMatch

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ASExpression> namedMatch(ASExpression target)
        Description copied from class: ASExpression
        Treat this ASExpression as a pattern and attempt to match against another expression. This operation differs from match in that it only hands back subexpressions which match named patterns.
        Overrides:
        namedMatch in class ASExpression
        Parameters:
        target - Treat "this" as a pattern and match against target.
        Returns:
        This method returns a mapping (name->subexpression) where for every named pattern in the pattern expression with name "x", there exists a mapping x->y where "y" is the subexpression in the target that matches the named pattern x.
        See Also:
        ASExpression.namedMatch(sexpression.ASExpression)

      • size

        public int size()
        Description copied from class: ASExpression
        Get the size of this expression. For lists, this is the number of elements. For strings, this is the number of bytes. For anything else, this will return 0.
        Specified by:
        size in class ASExpression
        Returns:
        This method returns the size of this expression.
        See Also:
        ASExpression.size()

      • toStringHelp

        public java.lang.StringBuffer toStringHelp()
        Description copied from class: ASExpression
        In order to make toString more efficient, each class of ASExpression must define a toStringHelp which returns a string buffer, rather than an actual string. This will make the construction of a representative string much more efficient.
        Specified by:
        toStringHelp in class ASExpression
        Returns:
        This method returns a string buffer which represents this expression.
        See Also:
        ASExpression.toStringHelp()

      • toVerbatimHelp

        public ByteArrayBuffer toVerbatimHelp()
        Description copied from class: ASExpression
        In order to make the process of creating a verbatim string more efficient, each type must define a representative ordered set of byte arrays. Copying this into all into a single byte array will open happen once per call to toVerbatim().
        Specified by:
        toVerbatimHelp in class ASExpression
        Returns:
        This method returns the verbatim byte-string representation of this ASExpression.
        See Also:
        ASExpression.toVerbatimHelp()
